key_messages:
Key Messages:

Four studies from the Azores and Australia found that seabird populations increased following the eradication of European rabbits Oryctolagus cuniculus or other species, although in three studies there were several other interventions used as well.
Two studies from Australia and the Madeira archipelago, Portugal, found that seabird populationsâ€™ productivities increased following rabbit and house mouse Mus musculus eradications, with several other interventions used in the Australian study.
